alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coweta; Heard (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 2:47PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Carroll, northwestern Heard and northwestern Coweta Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 246 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Tyus, or 11 miles southwest of Carrollton, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, pea sized hail and frequent cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Carrollton, Temple, Bowdon, Mount Zion, Whitesburg, Ephesus, Centralhatchee, Roopville, Plant Yates, Byers Crossroads, Tyus, Roosterville, Seaton Lake, Clem, Abilene, John Tanner State Park, Lowell, Plant Wansley and Blackjack Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for west central Georgia.
